Package com.example.freeturilo.connection

Interface API

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    APIConnector
    public interface API
    A service for API data transaction.

    Object of a class implementing this interface connects to an API and handles external data transactions of the application. Every method within this interface should be implemented as asynchronous and return the thread which handles the method's logic. An APIHandler can be provided (to handle potential transaction errors) in every method. A Callback can be provided (to handle received payload) in all methods that are expected to receive a payload. It is recommended to use APIRunnable for the method's implementation as it makes it easy to use APIHandler and Callback classes.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:
    Thread, Callback, APIHandler

    • Method Detail

      • getStationsAsync

        java.lang.Thread getStationsAsync​(Callback<java.util.List<Station>> callback,
                                  APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously gets a list of all bike stations. The payload of this transaction should contain the list of all bike stations.
        Parameters:
        callback - a method to be called when the transaction finishes correctly, takes the payload as a parameter
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • reportStationAsync

        java.lang.Thread reportStationAsync​(Station station,
                                    APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously reports a bike station.
        Parameters:
        station - the station to be reported
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • setBrokenStationAsync

        java.lang.Thread setBrokenStationAsync​(Station station,
                                       APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously sets a bike station state to broken. This transaction should only be accessible to an administrator.
        Parameters:
        station - the station to be set as broken
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • setWorkingStationAsync

        java.lang.Thread setWorkingStationAsync​(Station station,
                                        APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously sets a bike station state to working. This transaction should only be accessible to an administrator.
        Parameters:
        station - the station to be set as working
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • postUserAsync

        java.lang.Thread postUserAsync​(AuthCredentials authCredentials,
                               Callback<java.lang.String> callback,
                               APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously performs an administrator authentication. The payload of this transaction should contain an auth token to save in AuthTools.
        Parameters:
        authCredentials - a bundle of authentication credentials for an administrator account
        callback - a method to be called when the transaction finishes correctly, takes the payload as a parameter
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • getRouteAsync

        java.lang.Thread getRouteAsync​(RouteParameters routeParameters,
                               Callback<Route> callback,
                               APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously calculates a route with given parameters. The payload of this transaction should contain the calculated route.
        Parameters:
        routeParameters - a bundle of parameters to be used in route calculation
        callback - a method to be called when the transaction finishes correctly, takes the payload as a parameter
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • getStateAsync

        java.lang.Thread getStateAsync​(Callback<SystemState> callback,
                               APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously gets the system state. This transaction should only be accessible to an administrator. The payload of this transaction should contain the current system state.
        Parameters:
        callback - a method to be called when the transaction finishes correctly, takes the payload as a parameter
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • postStateAsync

        java.lang.Thread postStateAsync​(SystemState systemState,
                                APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously updates the system state. This transaction should only be accessible to an administrator.
        Parameters:
        systemState - the value of system state to be set
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • getNotifyThresholdAsync

        java.lang.Thread getNotifyThresholdAsync​(Callback<java.lang.Integer> callback,
                                         APIHandler handler)
        Asynchronously gets the threshold for administrator mail notifications. This method should only be accessible to an administrator. The payload of this transaction should contain the value of the threshold.
        Parameters:
        callback - a method to be called when the transaction finishes correctly, takes the payload as a parameter
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • postNotifyThresholdAsync

        Parameters:
        threshold - the value of the threshold to be set
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction
